text: All eligibility criteria met
label: Eligibilty
name: COND1

text: Stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL
name: COND2

text: 5 minutes after bedside PG reaches <60 mg/dL and insulin infusion is stopped.
name: COND3

description: Injection site assessment only required for IMG
text: Injection-site assessment for IMG only.
label: Injection site assessment
name: COND4

text: At periods 1 and 2 pts should have fasted at least 8 hoours before any study procedures
name: COND5

text: Only females of childbearing potential
name: COND6

text: Only Females when needed to confirm postmenopausal status
name: COND7

text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.
label: Admission
name: COND8

text: Patient may be discharged 6 hours after glucagon administration. A patient may remain inpatient at the CRU at the discretion of the investigator.
label: Discharge
name: COND9

text: After screening, medical assessment only performed to include medical review and targeted examination, as appropriate.
label: Physical Examination
name: COND10

description: Ability of patient to undergo hypoglycemia induction
text: Review patients’ insulin regimens to confirm acceptability to undergo the procedure to induce hypoglycemia.
label: Hypoglycemia induction check
name: COND11

text: After completion of all PK sampling, patients will be provided a carbohydrate-rich meal. The investigator will ensure the patient’s PG is stable. A prandial insulin dose will be administered if needed.
label: Carbohydrate-rich meal.
name: COND12

text: Procedures in Period 2 will occur at approximately the same time as those in Period 1. Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL.
label: Timing of insulin infusion
name: COND13

text: Patients do not need to fast for samples at screening or follow-up. At Periods 1 and 2, samples should be collected from patients who have fasted at least 8 hours before any study procedures.
label: Patient fasting
name: COND14

text: Serum pregnancy test will be performed at screening. Urine pregnancy test will be performed at every admission period and follow-up visit if applicable.
label: Pregnancy tests
name: COND15

text: When needed to confirm postmenopausal status.
label: FSH testing
name: COND16

text: Additional tests can be done at the discretion of the investigator.
label: Ethanol testing
name: COND17

text: Single sample for pharmacogenetic analysis taken prior to/on Period 1 Day -1.
label: Genetic sampling
name: COND18

text: In the event of drug hypersensitivity reactions (immediate or non-immediate), samples will be collected as close to event onset as possible, at event resolution, and 30 days following the event. Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.
label: Drug reactions
name: COND19

text: Nasal inspection both for IMG and LY900018.
label: Nasal site inspection
name: COND20

text: Time points may be added for Period 1 and Period 2 if warranted and agreed upon between Lilly and the investigator. Predose time point will be between insulin infusion stop and study treatment.
label: Triplicate 12-Lead ECG
name: COND21

text: Sampling times are relative to the time of study treatment administration (0 min). Predose time point will be between insulin infusion stop and study treatment.
label: PK (Glucagon)
name: COND22

text: Sampling times are relative to the time of study treatment administration (0 min). Predose time point will be between insulin infusion stop and study treatment.
label: Plasma Glucose
name: COND23

text: Sampling times are relative to the time of study treatment administration (0 min). Questionnaire will be collected in both LY900018 and IMG treatment groups in both periods.
label: Nasal and Non-Nasal Score
name: COND24

text: Sampling times are relative to the time of study treatment administration (0 min). During hypoglycemia induction will be when PG ≤75 mg/dL. Predose time point will be between insulin infusion stop and study treatment.
label: Edinburgh Scale
name: COND25
